snippet: The expansion, outlined in a report on the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy, would double the number of zones to six and include an additional 640,000 New York City residents.
abstract: Bloomberg administration says it will double, to six, the number of evacuation zones along New York City’s coast and expand them to include additional 640,000 residents, saying that new map will provide more flexibility when major storms hit.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HALBFINGER and ANEMONA HARTOCOLLIS

lead_paragraph: The expansion, outlined in a report on the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy, would double the number of zones to six and include an additional 640,000 New York City residents.

headline.seo: New York City to Double Number of Storm Evacuation Zones
headline.main: Adding Evacuation Zones in Response to Hurricane
headline.print_headline: Adding Evacuation Zones In Response to Hurricane
